name: vscode-extension-auto-import
displayName: Auto Import - ES6, TS, JSX, TSX
description: Automatically finds, parses and provides code actions and code completion for all available imports. Works with JavaScript and TypeScript. [Forked]

autoimport.extensions.description: Glob for files to watch and scan, e.g ./src/** ./src/app/**/*.ts. Defaults to **/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}

autoimport.absolute.description: True if the imports should be absolute to the workspace root

autoimport.sourceRoot.description: Change this if your absolute urls are not absolute from workspace root e.g ./src

autoimport.showNotifications.description: Specifies whether to show notifications from Auto Import

autoimport.doubleQuotes.description: Specifies whether to use double quotes

autoimport.semicolon.description: Specifies whether to use a semicolon at the end of the line

autoimport.spaceBetweenBraces.description: Specifies whether to use spaces between first and last brace

autoimport.autoComplete.description: Adds found items to intellisense and automatically imports then

autoimport.higherOrderComponents.description: This allows the importer to find your components name bypass the higher order components that you wrap it in. Each higher order component must be deliminated by pipe |. example: connect|withRouter

scripts.dev: yarn compile && NODE_ENV=dev yarn rollup --config rollup.dev.config.js --watch
scripts.build: yarn vscode:prepublish && NODE_ENV=prod yarn rollup --config rollup.prod.config.js
